intro: Regnaldia, commonly known as the golden bellflower, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the Campanulaceae family. It is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that typically range in color from yellow to orange. The plants are native to various regions in the Americas and are often found in woodland or rocky habitats. Regnaldia species usually have lance-shaped leaves and produce capsules as fruit. They are valued in horticulture for their ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in partial shade.
